result.execSummary:
The defendant Levi Mauricio Franco-Arango was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to complete an AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment at all times not incarcerated.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided.
